alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Labette (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 1:52PM CDT until June 05 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas... Neosho River at Oswego affecting Cherokee and Labette Counties. For the Neosho River...including Iola, Chanute, Erie, Parsons, Oswego...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neosho River at Oswego. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Xavier Road leading north from the river gage begins to see water near the road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 10.6 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Neosho River Oswego 17.0 19.8 Sat 7 am CDT 13.9 12.9 11.5 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
